metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: AngularJS Introduction
AngularJS is a JavaScript framework . It can be added to an HTML page with a <script> tag.
content.html: AngularJS is a JavaScript framework. It can be added to an HTML page with a <script> tag.

content.text: AngularJS extends HTML attributes with Directives , and binds data to HTML with Expressions .
content.html: AngularJS extends HTML attributes with Directives, and binds data to HTML with Expressions.

content.text: AngularJS is a JavaScript Framework
AngularJS is a JavaScript framework written in JavaScript.
content.html: AngularJS is a JavaScript framework written in JavaScript.

content.text: AngularJS is distributed as a JavaScript file, and can be added to a web page with a script tag:
content.html: AngularJS is distributed as a JavaScript file, and can be added to a web page with a script tag:

content.code_html: <script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/angularjs/1.6.9/angular.min.js"></script>

content.text: AngularJS Extends HTML
AngularJS extends HTML with ng-directives .
content.html: AngularJS extends HTML with ng-directives.

content.text: The ng-app directive defines an AngularJS application.
content.html: The ng-app directive defines an AngularJS application.

content.text: The ng-model directive binds the value of HTML controls (input, select, textarea) to application data.
content.html: The ng-model directive binds the value of HTML controls (input, select, textarea) to application data.

content.text: The ng-bind directive binds application data to the HTML view.
content.html: The ng-bind directive binds application data to the HTML view.

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/angularjs/1.6.9/angular.min.js"></script>
<body>

<div ng-app="">
  <p>Name: <input type="text" ng-model="name"></p>
  <p ng-bind="name"></p>
</div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Example explained:
content.html: Example explained:

content.text: AngularJS starts automatically when the web page has loaded.
content.html: AngularJS starts automatically when the web page has loaded.

content.text: The ng-app directive tells AngularJS that the <div> element is the "owner" of an AngularJS application .
content.html: The ng-app directive tells AngularJS that the <div> element is the "owner" of an AngularJS application.

content.text: The ng-model directive binds the value of the input field to the application variable name .
content.html: The ng-model directive binds the value of the input field to the application variable name.

content.text:
The ng-bind directive binds the content of the

element to the application variable name .
content.html: The ng-bind directive binds the content of the <p> element to the application variable name.

content.text: AngularJS Directives
As you have already seen, AngularJS directives are HTML attributes with an ng prefix.
content.html: As you have already seen, AngularJS directives are HTML attributes with an ng prefix.

content.text: The ng-init directive initializes AngularJS application variables.
content.html: The ng-init directive initializes AngularJS application variables.

content.code_html:
<div ng-app="" ng-init="firstName='John'">

<p>The name is <span ng-bind="firstName"></span></p>

</div>

content.text: Alternatively with valid HTML:
content.html: Alternatively with valid HTML:

content.code_html:
<div data-ng-app="" data-ng-init="firstName='John'">

<p>The name is <span data-ng-bind="firstName"></span></p>

</div>

content.text: You can use data-ng- , instead of ng- , if you want to make your page HTML valid.
content.html: You can use data-ng-, instead of ng-, if you want to make your page HTML valid.

content.text: You will learn a lot more about directives later in this tutorial.
content.html: You will learn a lot more about directives later in this tutorial.

content.text: AngularJS Expressions
AngularJS expressions are written inside double braces: {{ expression }} .
content.html: AngularJS expressions are written inside double braces: {{ expression }}.

content.text: AngularJS will "output" data exactly where the expression is written:
content.html: AngularJS will "output" data exactly where the expression is written:

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/angularjs/1.6.9/angular.min.js"></script>
<body>

<div ng-app="">
  <p>My first expression: {{ 5 + 5 }}</p>
</div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: AngularJS expressions bind AngularJS data to HTML the same way as the ng-bind directive.
content.html: AngularJS expressions bind AngularJS data to HTML the same way as the ng-bind directive.

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/angularjs/1.6.9/angular.min.js"></script>
<body>

<div ng-app="">
  <p>Name: <input type="text" ng-model="name"></p>
  <p>{{name}}</p>
</div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: You will learn more about expressions later in this tutorial.
content.html: You will learn more about expressions later in this tutorial.

content.text: AngularJS Applications
AngularJS modules define AngularJS applications.
content.html: AngularJS modules define AngularJS applications.

content.text: AngularJS controllers control AngularJS applications.
content.html: AngularJS controllers control AngularJS applications.

content.text: The ng-app directive defines the application, the ng-controller directive defines the controller.
content.html: The ng-app directive defines the application, the ng-controller directive defines the controller.

content.code:
First Name:
Last Name:

Full Name:{{firstName + " " + lastName}}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="myCtrl">

First Name: <input type="text" ng-model="firstName"><br>
Last Name: <input type="text" ng-model="lastName"><br>
<br>
Full Name: {{firstName + " " + lastName}}

</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope) {
  $scope.firstName= "John";
  $scope.lastName= "Doe";
});
</script>

content.text: AngularJS modules define applications:
content.html: AngularJS modules define applications:

content.code_html: var app = angular.module('myApp', []);

content.text: AngularJS controllers control applications:
content.html: AngularJS controllers control applications:

content.text: You will learn more about modules and controllers later in this tutorial.
content.html: You will learn more about modules and controllers later in this tutorial.
